R offers a multitude of packages related to health economics (a more comprehensive list can be found on the [home page](/). Below you can find a starter on the most common packages divided by indication.

# State transition models
State transition models are used to describe transitions between health states (e.g. healthy to sick). A number of models are available to implement in R.

## Decision trees
* `{rdecision}`
* `{data.tree}`

## Markov models
* `{mstate}`
* `{hesim}`
* `{heemod}`

## Microsimulation
* `{gems}` - Generalized Multistate Simulation Model
